titlestmt.titleproper: Barry Silverstein Collection of Direct Marketing Materials
Guide to the Barry Silverstein Collection of Direct Marketing Materials, 1871-1967 and undated RL.11273
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-02-07 16:32:10 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Barry Silverstein Collection of Direct Marketing Materials

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Direct marketing executive who worked at Xerox and Epsilon before founding Directech I eMerge in 1983.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Clippings File; and Mounted Advertisements.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Barry Silverstein Collection of Direct Marketing Materials were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Barry Silverstein Collection of Direct Marketing Materials, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0232

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections: Lester Wunderman papers; Wunderman Archives; Arlie Slabaugh Collection of Direct Marketing Materials.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of clippings, brochures and print advertisements relating to companies selling directly to consumers. Periodicals include American Magazine, Harper's Monthly, Hearth and Home, Liberty, McCall's and Youth's Companion. Companies represented include Aetna, Alexander Hamilton Institute, Bristol-Myers, Brunswick, Burroughs, Corn Products Sales (Karo), Gold Medal, Jergens and Sears. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
